intro: Lecontea bojeriana, commonly known as the Bojer's lecontea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polemoniaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and Georgia. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
